mapper.update:
update employee
name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
sex = #{sex,jdbcType=CHAR},
birthday = #{birthday,jdbcType=DATE},
idcard = #{idcard,jdbcType=CHAR},
wedding = #{wedding,jdbcType=CHAR},
nation = #{nation,jdbcType=CHAR},
place = #{place,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
politic = #{politic,jdbcType=CHAR},
email = #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
phone = #{phone,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
address = #{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
department = #{department,jdbcType=INTEGER},
position = #{position,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
engageform = #{engageform,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
education = #{education,jdbcType=CHAR},
major = #{major,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
school = #{school,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
begindate = #{begindate,jdbcType=DATE},
workstate = #{workstate,jdbcType=CHAR},
workID = #{workid,jdbcType=CHAR},
paperlimit = #{paperlimit,jdbcType=DOUBLE},
conversiondate = #{conversiondate,jdbcType=DATE},
leavedate = #{leavedate,jdbcType=DATE},
beginpaperdate = #{beginpaperdate,jdbcType=DATE},
endpaperdate = #{endpaperdate,jdbcType=DATE},
workage = #{workage,jdbcType=INTEGER},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update employee set name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, sex = #{sex,jdbcType=CHAR}, birthday = #{birthday,jdbcType=DATE}, idcard = #{idcard,jdbcType=CHAR}, wedding = #{wedding,jdbcType=CHAR}, nation = #{nation,jdbcType=CHAR}, place = #{place,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, politic = #{politic,jdbcType=CHAR}, email = #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, phone = #{phone,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, address = #{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, department = #{department,jdbcType=INTEGER}, position = #{position,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, engageform = #{engageform,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, education = #{education,jdbcType=CHAR}, major = #{major,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, school = #{school,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, begindate = #{begindate,jdbcType=DATE}, workstate = #{workstate,jdbcType=CHAR}, workID = #{workid,jdbcType=CHAR}, paperlimit = #{paperlimit,jdbcType=DOUBLE}, conversiondate = #{conversiondate,jdbcType=DATE}, leavedate = #{leavedate,jdbcType=DATE}, beginpaperdate = #{beginpaperdate,jdbcType=DATE}, endpaperdate = #{endpaperdate,jdbcType=DATE}, workage = #{workage,jdbcType=INTEGER} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select:
SELECT count(*) FROM employee WHERE 1 = 1
and id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}

select er.id, er.eid, er.afterdepartment afterDepartment, er.afterjob afterjob, er.removedate removeDate, er.reason, er.remark, e.`name` employeeName, p.`name` positionName, d.`name` departmentName from employee_remove er LEFT JOIN employee e on e.id = er.eid LEFT JOIN position p on p.id = e.position Left JOIN department d on d.id = e.department limit #{beginPage,jdbcType=INTEGER},#{pageSize,jdbcType=INTEGER}
select count(*) from employee_remove er LEFT JOIN employee e on e.id = er.eid LEFT JOIN position p on p.id = e.position Left JOIN department d on d.id = e.department
